items.preText: nico: "There's no need to panic I guess. Bangladesh have faced the critical situation smartly. Mithun's yet to prove why he's on the team. & It'sa perfect time to prove. "
items.text: short around the hip and de Grandhomme doesn't have the pace to hurry Shakib, gets quickly into position and pulls it away towards deep square leg and into the gap
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: length outside off, slower ball, steered to short third-man
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: slower ball on the pads this time, nudged to deep square leg's left, lovely placement gets him two
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

items.text: length outside off, Shakib throws his hands at it but luckily for him it just eludes the outstretched hands of the short third-man fielder
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: full on middle, Shakib turns the face too early and gets a leading edge that was in the air briefly but wide of the diving point fielder
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, steered to short third-man
items.shortText: Santner to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: drops his length short as Shakib shapes to come down, rocks back seeing it shorter and cuts it away to deep cover
items.shortText: Santner to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length on the pads, tucked away towards square leg to bring up Bangladesh's 150
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: slower and angled across, Shakib wants to work it leg side, gets a bit of an edge to the off side
items.shortText: Santner to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Shakib makes room, Santner follows him with a full one, pushed to deep square leg
items.shortText: Santner to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: full and angled in, defended
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: length and angled in from around the wicket, Shakib looks to cut but it's too close, chops it away towards point
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: against the run of play Bangladesh lose Shakib! A mirron image of the previous delivery, angled in on a length from around the wicket, Shakib looks to cut again but it's far too close for the stroke, perhaps a tad full as well, the outside edge or maybe a bottom edge, yes looks like that is induced and pouched brilliantly by Latham standing up to the stumps
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Shakib Al Hasan, OUT

dismissal.text: Shakib Al Hasan c †Latham b de Grandhomme 64 (98m 68b 7x4 0x6) SR: 94.11

items.text: length outside off, steered to short third-man
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mahmudullah, 1 wide

items.text: short outside off, cut away to deep cover-point for one
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mahmudullah, 1 run

items.preText:
Leonardo : "Just as I was about to say Bangladesh may well be on course to best their highest ever ODI total, they lose Hasan, I however think they still can."

Rushdi Shams: "Converting 50's to 100's helps a team tremendously-Bangladesh middle order often fails to realize it. "

items.text: tossed up on middle, stretches forward and defends

items.text: flatter on middle, comes forward to defend, gets a thick inside edge towards square leg

items.text: quicker one, angled in, driven to long-off

items.text: goes flatter and on middle, wasn't short enough to be cutting and that's where he beat the batsman in length, the inside edge goes past the leg stump, however
